III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms
of intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to:
1

(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A was allegedly hit in the mouth by Staff 1.
Investigation The complainant was interviewed on 11/15/2023 during an
unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility. No additional
information was provided.
Youth A was interviewed on 11/17/2023 with DHHS Worker 1 and
Law enforcement during an announced, face-to-face visit at the
facility. Youth A stated that he had been outside of the main
building on the date in question and walked up to the medication
building a few hundred yards away. Youth A recalled Staff 1
following him. Youth A stated that he was knocking on the
windows of the medication building trying to find his case
manager. Youth A stated that Staff 1 was trying to get his hand
away from the windows. Youth A recalled that Staff 1 hit Youth A
in the mouth as this was attempted. Youth A stated that he was
also picking stuff up and throwing it at the windows. Youth A
clarified that as he picked up something to throw at the windows,
Staff 1‘s left forearm hit Youth A in his mouth from his right side.
Youth A stated that he did not fall down. Youth A believed that
Staff 2 and Staff 3 were in sight of the incident. Youth A did not
believe that this physical contact was a punch. Youth A stated he
told people initially he had been punched, but that was not
accurate. Youth A recalled stating “You just hit me in my mouth”
and he recalled Staff 1 stating back “No, I didn’t, I don’t know what
you’re talking about.” Youth A did not believe he was injured as a
result of the incident.
Staff 2 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 and Law
enforcement on 11/17/2023 during an announced, face-to-face
visit at the facility. She stated that she was not directly involved in
the incident itself, but saw parts of it. Staff 2 recalled seeing Youth
A with Staff 1 near the medication building. She recalled seeing
Youth A attempt to break windows and throw something at the
building. Staff 2 recalled seeing Staff 1 standing by the front door
and attempting to stand in between Youth A and the window. At
this point Staff 2 did not see any physical contact between Staff 1
and Youth A. Staff 2 recalled hearing Youth A yell “He hit me”
referring to Staff 1. Staff 2 reiterated that she never saw Staff 1
put his hands on Youth A.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 12/01/2023 with DHHS Worker 1 and
Law enforcement during an announced, face-to-face visit at the
2

facility. Staff 1 recalled the incident in question. He stated that
Youth A had left the main building and that he followed Youth A
outside to provide line of sight. Youth A went up to the medication
building a few hundred yards away and was pounding on the
windows and walking around the building. Staff 1 recalled
attempting to stand in between Youth A as Youth A attempted to
hit and throw items like rocks and sticks at the windows. Staff 1
stated that Youth A first made contact with him when Youth A tried
to push him out of the way as Youth A moved from the back of the
building up towards the front. Staff 1 stated that he did not put his
hands on Youth A at this point in time. Staff 1 recalled following
Youth A up to the front of the building, and Staff 1 attempted to
stand in between Youth A and the front door. Staff 1 recalled that
Youth A then was within arm’s reach of Staff 1 and turned into
Staff 1 and they made contact. Staff 1 stated that he was not
making an attempt to have physical contact with Youth A nor was
he trying to physically restrain Youth A. Staff 1 recalled Youth A
then moving backwards away from him and stating, “You punched
me.” Staff 1 denied ever punching or hitting Youth A. Staff 1 stated
that Youth A then picked up a lawn ornament and threatened to hit
Staff 1 with it, only to then throw it away. Staff 1 stated that his
main concern at that point was to try to keep Youth A from hurting
himself as he was trying to hit things on the building, as well as try
to ensure that Youth A did not have contact with another youth
that he knew was inside the medication building that was in crisis.
Staff 1 stated that all he attempted to do with Youth A was to slide
in front of him when he could to create a barrier between Youth A
and the building. Staff 1 recalled that the incident ended when
Youth A walked towards the parking lot away from the medication
building and made contact with other staff.
Youth B was interviewed on 12/01/2023 with DHHS Worker 1 and
Law enforcement during an announced, face-to-face visit at the
facility. Youth B stated that he saw the incident in question
because he was inside the medication building when Youth A
approached, and he happened to be in a room with a window
facing outside where Youth A was located. Youth B recalled
seeing Youth A with a metal object outside the building, and that
he was banging and hitting on windows. Youth B believed that
Staff 1 grabbed the metal object out of Youth A’s hands, but did so
without making other physical contact with Youth A. Youth B
stated that he never saw Staff 1 put his hands on Youth A during
any other part of the incident. Youth B recalled Staff 1 attempting
to stand in between Youth A and the building. Youth B believed he
saw Youth A push Staff 1 at one point, but then Youth A backed
off.
3

Documents reviewed:
• A safety plan dated 11/14/2023 was provided that detailed
that Staff 1 was not to work alone with Youth A, nor was he
to be within arm's distance of Youth A.
• Discipline information for Staff 1 was reviewed. He has one
item within his personnel record of discipline for facility
policy on supervision of youth, dated 04/03/2023.
• An incident report authored by Staff 1 dated 11/14/2023
was reviewed. The incident report contained a recollection
of events that was consistent with interviews. It stated that
Youth A made contact first with Staff 1 when he shoved
and pushed Staff 1, and then later in the interaction when
Youth A head butted against Staff 1’s arm as Staff 1 was
attempting to stand in between Youth A and the building
they were near.
• Additional written statements dated 11/14/2023 were
reviewed:
o Staff 1 wrote a statement that was consistent with
the incident report.
o Youth A wrote a statement that stated that Staff 1 hit
him in the mouth outside the medical building.
o Staff 2’s written statement that was consistent with
her interview.
o Staff 3’s wrote a statement. This stated that she
witnessed Youth A attempting to hit the medical
building with items he found outside, as well as
punching windows. Staff 2 stated that Staff 1
attempted to stop this by standing in between the
building and Youth A. Staff 2 stated she witnessed
Youth A punch Staff 1 in the chest and eventually
Youth A walked away.
Analysis Through interviews with youth and staff and documentation
collected there were no violations found between Youth A and
Staff 1 for the incident that occurred on 11/14/2023.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
